name: German Club
description: German Students from MHS meet monthly to share and inspire learning about German Language and Culture.

name: Comets in Action
description: Together, peer buddies and students with disabilities will play games, make crafts, and generally have a good time socially. We meet once per month after school on the third Wednesday of the month.

name: Power of the Pen
description: Power of the Pen is a competitive writing team. If you love creative writing, try out for Power of the Pen in the fall!

name: Spanish Club
description: The Spanish club is a place for all students to explore different Spanish speaking countries' traditions, foods, music, and culture. Each month we focus on a different tradition of a specific country and celebrate it as they do in there. Spanish language experience is not required, all students are welcome!

name: Student Impact
description: This group meets on Wednesday morning for about 10 minutes to fellowship with one another, have a brief discussion about scripture, and pray for each other, our school, and our community.

name: Rubik's Club
description: Rubik's club is a club for anyone interested in connecting and cubing.  We have a very friendly and welcoming group of students who spend time connecting, talking, and sharing strategies for solving a variety of cubes.  We keep track of every participant's different solves and times to see improvement week to week.  If you enjoy meeting new people who also love cubing, this is the place for you.

name: Stock Market Club
description: Stock Market Club is an opportunity for students to learn more about the stock market and investing. Students also participate in groups to compete in the Stock Market Game to see how real life investing strategies work in the real world.

name: Science Olympiad
description:
Attention all MMS students! Are you a 7th or 8th grader interested in learning and competing in various fields of science? Science Olympiad is the perfect team for you! Featuring events ranging from Life Sciences, Earth & Space, Physics and Chemistry, to Technology & Engineering, our club has something for everyone. 
 
Science Olympiad gives members a chance to discover exciting new fields of science, all while making new friends, and having fun/working together with teammates at meetings! Our team attends high-level competitions (Regionals, States, possibly Nationals), and you’ll be sure to make countless memories you’ll never forget.

name: MMS Student Council
description: MMS Student Council is an organization of Mason 7th and 8th grade students who are interested in helping to make our school and our community a better place to live and learn.

name: MMS Cooking Club
description: MMS Cooking Club is a unique opportunity for students to learn basic cooking and baking skills in their own kitchens!  Presented in an online, video conference format, the MMS Cooking class will present students with the opportunity to complete a variety of recipes from start to finish and then share with their families!

name: GSA
description:
The Mason Middle School GSA is a student group that focuses on connecting students in the LGBTQ+ community and their allies.  

GSA is open to all MMS students--7th and 8th graders!

name: BSU
description:
The Mason Middle School Black Student Union (BSU) is a student group that focuses on connecting Black students and allies in a welcoming and supportive environment.

BSU is open to all MMS students--7th and 8th graders!

name: The Write Space
description: Do you love to write creative stories? Would you like to make your talent stronger? Then you’ve come to the right place! “The Write Space” is an interactive writing club where you learn to improve your writing skills through interactive mini-lessons, spend time  sharing your writing with other students, and develop your talent with the help of your peers. Meetings will be held every Thursday in room 217 with Mrs. Hahn from 2:30-3:15.

name: Mathcounts
description: Strong math skills/abilities

name: Fearlessly Girl Club
description: Fearlessly Girl is designed to give all girls, and those identifying as such a safe place to come together and target the unique challenges girls face in our modern world.  This club will give girls the tools and confidence they need to help create a kinder and more supportive girl-to-girl environment.
advisorName: Katie Lenart (soon to be Katie Bradley 4/23/22)
advisorEmail: lenartk@masonohioschools.com (email will change for 22-23 school year)

name: FBLA
description: Future Business Leaders of America is a club for students who are interested in learning more about business and skills that will help them be successful in the future.

name: Builders Club
description:
Builders Club is an international student-led organization providing members with opportunities to perform service, build character and develop leadership.

Everyone is Welcome in Builders Club.  We learn how to lead and make things happen. We discover how to work with each other and bring out the best in one another. Best of all, we make friends who care as much as we do about creating a better world.

name: NoteWorthy
description: NoteWorthy is an auditioned pop a cappella ensemble that meets FIRST semester after school on WEDNESDAYS from 2:35-3:30 in the MMS Choir Room 609.  Auditions are scheduled in early September and are open to any MMS student.  There is a $35 club fee for NoteWorthy (no student will be refused due to financial hardship).  NoteWorthy performs in the A Cappella Clinic (Oct.) the 7th and 8th grade choral concerts (Dec.) and the MHS Elegant Holiday (Dec.).

name: MMS Drama Club/MMS Stage Crew
description: Mason Middle Theater encompasses both MMS Drama Club (for cast) and MMS Stage Crew (for crew), and we put on a musical each school year.
sectionOneTitle: Shrek Stage Crew Meeting: Wednesday, October 12, 2022 in the MMS Auditorium 2:45-3:30
sectionTwoTitle: Shrek Cast Meeting: Thursday, October 13 2022 2:45-3:45 in the MMS Choir Room

name: Muslim Students Association (MSA)
description: The purpose of Muslim Student Association (MSA) is to provide a safe, stress-free, and fun space for Muslim students to improve and support our own community [Ummah]; we promote open dialogue regarding issues affecting the local, national, and international Islamic community. We desire to share the beauty and diversity of the global Muslim community while having a positive impact on our middle school and the larger Mason City School community.

name: MMS/MHS CometCast
description: CometCast is a student-driven creative podcast institution produced by students at Mason Middle School and Mason High School in Mason, Ohio. Our mission is to give everyone a voice. We want to showcase the achievements of students, staff, and community members in Mason, and also discuss issues that go unnoticed. For our second season, we are focusing specifically on highlighting Mason's "3 Big Rocks", so tune in to find out more!
